definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: He that lives upon hope, dies farting.
sentences.chinese: 一味靠希望活着的人，死时不值一文。
这种谴责是不值一顾的。

sentences.english: Watermelons in Beijing in the summer are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 北京的夏天，西瓜多得根本不值钱了。

sentences.english: So is the expansion worth it?
sentences.chinese: 这个资料片到底值不值？

sentences.english: They finally found a small gold coin which was almost worthless.
sentences.chinese: 最后找到的是一枚几乎一钱不值的小金币。

sentences.english: But if you just value money than your opinion is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你只看重钱，你的观点分文不值。

sentences.english: Or all the riches that East doth hold.
sentences.chinese: 你的爱让东部的财富不值一文。

sentences.english: Some do not worth value , some gorgeous expensive, but seldom appear.
sentences.chinese: 有的不值价值，有的华丽又昂贵，却很少出现。

sentences.english: By cock and pie it is not worth a penny.
sentences.chinese: 说句天地良心话，那根本一文不值。

sentences.english: They start fighting about something that really doesn't deserve fighting.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始为了不值一提的事情争吵起来。

sentences.english: Such cultural comparisons, however, are notoriously subjective.
sentences.chinese: 然而这样的文化比较非常主观，不值一顾。

sentences.english: The truth is, the man's not worth a hill of beans.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这小我根柢一钱不值。

sentences.english: Don't throw away your savings on shares that will be worthless in a few years.
sentences.chinese: 别把你的积蓄浪费在几年后就不值一文的股票上去。

sentences.english: I never said you were worthless. What I said was you’re not worth your weight in gold.
It really isn t worth mentioning.
Not a copper farthing's worth of it!

definition: it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
to love dearly/to feel sorry for sb/to regret/to grudge/to be distressed
see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to accuse wrongly/to treat unjustly/injustice/wronged/not worthwhile
drop in price/devalued/to have one's status lowered
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
